page.title: 08Dewi Sant Graig Pontypridd
page.content:
A group of children went to Dewi Sant hospital. There has been a hospital there since 1865.At first it was known as the Union Workhouse where poor people could go to work and get food. It was hard and unpleasant in the workhouse and not many people went there.In 1967 a hospital was built and opened in 1968 so that they could install the equipment.This is a geriatric hospital and it looks after people over 70. In the new hospital there are 128 beds,4 wards and 300 staff who do different jobs including physiotherapists, occupational therapists,radiographers,E.C.G. technicians,engineers,plumbers,cooks, doctors,nurses,gardeners and telephone operators.
By Richard Turner of Graig-y-wion school.
